intro: Humboltia nittiorhyncha, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, tubular flowers that bloom in the evening. It produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Humboltia nittiorhyncha is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
